Welcome to Camera_simulator’s documentation!

camera_simulator package

Submodules

camera_simulator.base_processor module

Base processor of a camera simulator

Abstract class with the abstract method process that will have the processes of the camera compounds. Also, it tells if the camera is enabled or not.

Typical usage example:

class ExampleClass(Base_processor):

class camera_simulator.base_processor.Base_processor[source]

Bases: abc.ABC

The base processor of a camera simulator

_enable

A boolean indicating if the base processor is enabled or not.

property enable

Getter of the enable property

abstract process(image)[source]

Abstract method of the process of the camera compoounds.

camera_simulator.lens module

Lens of a camera simulator

Iterator class that simulates the lens of a camera given the dimension height and width of the lens.

Typical usage example:

lens1 = Lens(height,width) processed_img = sensor1.process(image)

class camera_simulator.lens.Lens(_height, _width)[source]

Bases: base_processor.Base_processor

The lens of a camera simulator

_height

An integer indicating the height of the lens.

_width

An integer indicating the width of the lens.

Raises

TypeError – The height and the width must be Integers.

decorator()[source]

Decorator to have Lens process method at the same of other method.

property height

Getter of the height property

process(image)[source]

Compares lens dimensions and an image dimensions.

Process method that compares the dimensions of an image with the Lens height and width.

Parameters

image – 2D numpy data of the image.

Returns

The 2D numpy data of the image.

Raises

ValueError – The size of the image is different to the lens height and width.

property width

Getter of the width property

camera_simulator.sensor module

Sensor of a camera simulator

Iterator class that simulates the sensor of a camera given a sensor gain, an image, a lens and the size of the iterator.

Typical usage example:

sensor1 = Sensor(gain,image,lens,10) processed_img = sensor1.process(image) for i in sensor1:

print(i)

class camera_simulator.sensor.Sensor(_gain, image, lens, _max=10)[source]

Bases: base_processor.Base_processor

The sensor of a camera simulator that can be used as an iterator.

_gain

An integer indicating the gain of the sensor.

image

2D numpy data of the image.

lens

Object of type Lens.

_max

An integer of the maximum value of the iterator.

Raises

  • The gain and the maximum iterator must be Integers –

  • The image must be a numpy array –

  • The lens must be a Lens object –

property gain

Getter of the gain property

lens_update(lens)[source]

Updates the value of the height and the width in case it was changed.

process(**kargs)

Abstract method of the process of the camera compoounds.

camera_simulator.sensor.concurrent()[source]

Uses the concurrent package with max 5 workers to call mymean function 100 times, with a 10x10 image.

camera_simulator.sensor.mymean(im_height=None, im_width=None, seed=None)[source]

The mean of an image through a Sensor object.

Parameters

  • seed – The random seed if it is needed.

  • im_heiht – An integer indicating the image height.

  • im_width – An integer indicating the image height.
